metadata.title: CVE-2019-17637 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
In all versions of Eclipse Web Tools Platform through release 3.18 (2020-06), XML and DTD files referring to external entities could be exploited to send the contents of local files to a remote server when edited or validated, even when external entity resolution is disabled in the user preferences.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17637` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libeclipse-jem-util-java - 3.18-2
libeclipse-wst-common-core-java - 3.18-2
libeclipse-wst-common-emf-java - 3.18-2
libeclipse-wst-common-emfworkbench-integration-java - 3.18-2
libeclipse-wst-common-environment-java - 3.18-2
libeclipse-wst-common-frameworks-java - 3.18-2
libeclipse-wst-common-frameworks-ui-java - 3.18-2
libeclipse-wst-common-project-facet-core-java - 3.18-2
libeclipse-wst-common-ui-java - 3.18-2
libeclipse-wst-common-uriresolver-java - 3.18-2
libeclipse-wst-sse-core-java - 3.18-2
libeclipse-wst-sse-ui-java - 3.18-2
libeclipse-wst-validation-java - 3.18-2
libeclipse-wst-validation-ui-java - 3.18-2
libeclipse-wst-xml-core-java - 3.18-2
libeclipse-wst-xml-ui-java - 3.18-2
libeclipse-wst-xsd-core-java - 3.18-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: eclipse-wtp package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.18-2').
